definitions.example: To reach the building, we had to climb a steep incline.

definitions.definition: To bend or move (something) out of a given plane or direction, often the horizontal or vertical.
definitions.example: He had to incline his body against the gusts to avoid being blown down in the storm.
Over the centuries the wind made the walls of the farmhouse incline.

definitions.definition: (chiefly in the passive) To tend to do or believe something, or move or be moved in a certain direction, away from a point of view, attitude, etc.
definitions.example: He inclines to believe anything he reads in the newspapers.
